title: TFR Ep. 609: Top Gun: Maverick, The Sadness, 5 Favorite Childhood Crushes
description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt break out the aviators and cue up the Kenny Loggins for the sequel to that Tom Cruise volleyball movie, ‘Top Gun: Maverick’. 35+ years later, is the magic still there, or was the original such an artifact of its time that the past should have been left well enough alone.  Then it’s on to Taiwan for the extreme horror riff on The Crazies, ‘The Sadness’.  Described as “The most violent and depraved zombie movie of all time”, can it possibly live up to the hype?  As always, there’s the breakdown of the big Physical Media releases and the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris wrap up the show with their Top 5 Childhood Pop Culture Crushes…man that’s a mouthful.

00:00-24:49: Intro/Top Gun: Maverick

24:50-41:16: Physical Media Picks

41:17-52:05: The Sadness

52:06-1:06:43: 5 Favorite Childhood Crushes

1:06:44-1:08:18: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

itunes:subtitle: This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt break out the aviators to discuss the return of Captain Pete Mitchell in ‘Top Gun: Maverick’. Then it’s the Taiwanese zombie shocker, ‘The Sadness’. And the guys discuss their 5 Favorite Childhood Crushes.
itunes:summary:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt break out the aviators and cue up the Kenny Loggins for the sequel to that Tom Cruise volleyball movie, ‘Top Gun: Maverick’. 35+ years later, is the magic still there, or was the original such an artifact of its time that the past should have been left well enough alone.  Then it’s on to Taiwan for the extreme horror riff on The Crazies, ‘The Sadness’.  Described as “The most violent and depraved zombie movie of all time”, can it possibly live up to the hype?  As always, there’s the breakdown of the big Physical Media releases and the Straight to DVD and Streaming Picks of the Week.  Then Matt and Chris wrap up the show with their Top 5 Childhood Pop Culture Crushes…man that’s a mouthful.
